tweets.text: @JamesBevanEA @PJennings88 @EnvAgency More top end overhead in an organisation already top heavy, at a time when it is claimed budgets are shrinking, so less to spend at the front end, where it is needed. Couldn't see this happening in the private sector.

Kitchen roll is one of the top 3 #unflushables people admit to having flushed down the loo. 
 
However, unlike toilet paper it doesn't dissolve and instead causes blockages. 
 
Never flush kitchen roll. 
 
Protect your pipes and our environment.

#Unblocktober #BinIt4Beaches https://t.co/jDhrwcuFFI

tweets.text: Action plan to implement @EnvAgency FCERM strategy will be available from April says Julie Foley. Strategic overview role vital to effectively help all the partners in the strategy to work together. #FloodandCoast2020

The flood embankment in St Peter's Fields is almost complete as part of York flood defences.

We now need to close the footpath intermittently between 26 Oct -18 December to raise the flood defences on Almery Terrace & fit with flood-resistant glass panels.

#flooding #york https://t.co/wniec1wkN5

The @EnvAgency‚Äôs @EmmaHowardBoyd calls on individuals, communities, charities, businesses, farmers, land managers and infrastructure providers to build resilience of millions more homes and businesses.

‚ÄòWe will work with anyone and everyone ‚Äì even the beavers.‚Äù

#UKClimateAdapt

Keynote speaker @EmmaHowardBoyd of @EnvAgency says treating mitigation and adaptation as two sides of the same coin is 'key to the success of the green recovery from Covid-19 and also the UK‚Äôs ability to inspire a game-changing international agreement at COP26.' #UKClimateAdapt

urls.title: Coastal Communities Adapting Together Exchanging Knowledge and Best Practice Across Borders - CCAT Project
urls.description: As climate change and sustainability become central elements of policy making there is an opportunity to learn from others and to build on existing best practice in coastal management, climate change and adaptation. The Coastal Communities Adapting Together (CCAT) event hosted by Fingal County Council and Cardiff University brought¬† together a diverse range of practitioners [‚Ä¶]
